description.p: Pure utilitarians driven by an overwhelming need to destroy great evils of the world are sometimes offered great power in return for a fraction of their soul. Those who agree to this dire bargain are known as Pact Warriors. They give part of themselves over to these powerful unknown benefactors who impart them with a small portion of their arcane power.

div.p: Subclasses that grant martial characters access to spellcasting, like the Blood Hunter’s Order of the Profane Soul, can easily upset the balance of the game. However, the archetype of a warrior who offers part of themselves for eldritch power is thematically powerful. The Pact Warrior is an attempt to bring this archetype into the game while abiding by the design goals of 5e.

description.p: Beginning at 3rd level, your bargain with an eldritch power allows you to cast spells much like a warlock does.
Cantrips. You learn two cantrips of your choice from the warlock spell list. You learn an additional warlock cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

Spell Slots. The Pact Warrior Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your warlock spells of 1st-level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.

Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher. At 3rd level, you learn two 1st-level spells of your choice from the warlock spell list. The Spells Known column of the Pact Warrior Spellcasting table shows when you learn more warlock spells of your choice of 1st-level or higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what’s shown in the table’s Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 7th level, for example, you learn a new warlock spell, which can be 1st or 2nd-level. When you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the warlock spells you know and replace it with another spell from the warlock spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Spellcasting Ability. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your warlock spells. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability, when setting the saving throw DC for a warlock spell you cast, and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

The deal you have made with your mysterious patron allows you to draw upon their overwhelming power by sacrificing your own vitality. Starting at 3rd level, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one of your hit dice to deal necrotic damage to the target, in addition to the weapon’s damage. The extra damage is 2d10 for a one hit die, plus 1d10 for each additional hit die, to a maximum of 5d10.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one of your hit dice to deal necrotic damage to the target, in addition to the weapon’s damage. The extra damage is 2d10 for a one hit die, plus 1d10 for each additional hit die, to a maximum of 5d10.

description.p: Beginning at 7th level, you can draw upon the sinister magic within you to slip through cracks in reality. As an action, you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. If you appear within 5 feet of another creature, you can make one melee weapon attack against that creature as part of the same action.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. If you appear within 5 feet of another creature, you can make one melee weapon attack against that creature as part of the same action.

description.p: You learn how to undercut a creature’s resistance to your spells with your weapon strikes. Starting at 10th level, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

description.p: You have learned to restore your own vitality with the suffering of others. Beginning at 15th level, when you use your Sanguine Offering ability to empower a weapon attack with at least one hit die, you gain temporary hit points equal to the additional necrotic damage dealt to the creature.
Temporary hit points from this ability last for one minute, or until you gain temporary hit points from a different source.

sheet.description: When you use your Sanguine Offering ability to empower a weapon attack with at least one hit die, you gain temporary hit points equal to the additional necrotic damage dealt to the creature. Temporary hit points from this ability last for one minute, or until you gain temporary hit points from a different source.

description.p: Upon reaching 18th level, you can offer the souls of your slain foes to your mysterious eldritch benefactor in return for a temporary surge of deadly strength, arcane potency, or vitality. As a reaction, when a creature that you can see dies within 30 feet of you, you harvest their soul and gain one of the following benefits:

ul.li: You recover one of your expended Pact Magic spell slots.
You gain advantage on all your weapon attacks until the end of your next turn.

description.p: You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When a creature that you can see dies within 30 feet of you, you harvest their soul and gain one of the following benefits: You recover one of your expended Pact Magic spell slots. You gain advantage on all your weapon attacks until the end of your next turn. You regain 1d4 +1 expended hit dice.

description.p: Phalanx warriors are elite fighters who excel at fighting as a unit. Skilled with weapons of all types, they are especially deadly with a protective style of fighting that utilizes a spear and shield. They use their combat training to coordinate their tactics with those of their allies, becoming a deadly unit on the battlefield. When fighting alone, a Phalanx warrior is a minor threat, but when combined with powerful allies they are a force to be reckoned with.

When you adopt this archetype at 3rd level, you master a special form of silent communication. You can communicate simple ideas and concepts to creatures that can see you through hand signals and body movements.
Over the course of a short rest you can teach creatures of your choice how to communicate using these signals.

sheet.description: You can communicate simple ideas and concepts to creatures that can see you through hand signals and body movements. Over the course of a short rest you can teach creatures of your choice how to communicate using these signals.

description.p: Beginning at 3rd level your training as a phalanx warrior allows you to protect your allies in combat. As long as you are wielding a shield, you can use a bonus action to enter a defensive stance to protect nearby allies. While in your defensive stance, both you, and friendly creatures of your choice within 5 feet, gain a +1 bonus to their armor class. While in your defensive stance your movement speed is reduced by 10 feet. Your defensive stance ends if you fall unconscious, or choose to end it as a bonus action.

While you are in your defensive stance you gain access to certain defensive maneuvers detailed below. You can execute a number of defensive maneuvers equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

Bash. When you take the attack action on your turn, you can use your bonus action to make an attack with your shield. This shield attack deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier on hit.

Block. You can use this defensive maneuver as a reaction when a creature under the effects of your defensive stance is targeted by an attack. Until the start of your next turn, the creature adds the bonus of your shield to their armor class, and you lose any benefits of your shield.

sheet.description: As long as you are wielding a shield, you can use a bonus action to enter a defensive stance to protect nearby allies. While in your defensive stance, both you, and friendly creatures of your choice within 5 feet, gain a +{{defensive-stance:ac}} bonus to their armor class. While in your defensive stance your movement speed is reduced by 10 feet.

description.p: When you take the attack action on your turn, you can use your bonus action to make an attack with your shield. This shield attack deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier on hit.

sheet.description: When you take the attack action on your turn, you can use your bonus action to make an attack with your shield. This shield attack deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + {{strength:modifier}} on hit.

description.p: You can use this defensive maneuver as a reaction when a creature under the effects of your defensive stance is targeted by an attack. Until the start of your next turn, the creature adds the bonus of your shield to their armor class, and you lose any benefits of your shield.

sheet.description: When a creature under the effects of your defensive stance is targeted by an attack, the creature adds the bonus of your shield to their armor class, and you lose any benefits of your shield until the start of your next turn.

description.p: The potency of your combat style increases as you gain experience. Starting at 7th level, you can use the following defensive maneuvers while in your defensive stance.
Brace. As a reaction when you are forced to make a saving throw to resist being grappled, moved against your will, or knocked prone, you can grant yourself advantage on your roll.

Intercept. When a creature benefiting from your defensive stance is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to interpose yourself between them and the attack. If the attack roll would exceed your armor class, you take the damage from the attack.
As a reaction when you are forced to make a saving throw to resist being grappled, moved against your will, or knocked prone, you can grant yourself advantage on your roll.

sheet.description: When you are forced to make a saving throw to resist being grappled, moved against your will, or knocked prone, you can grant yourself advantage on your roll.

description.p: When a creature benefiting from your defensive stance is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to interpose yourself between them and the attack. If the attack roll would exceed your armor class, you take the damage from the attack.

sheet.description: When a creature benefiting from your defensive stance is hit by an attack, you can interpose yourself between them and the attack. If the attack roll would exceed your armor class, you take the damage from the attack.

description.p: You have improved your defensive stance technique so that you and your allies may better defend one another. Starting at 10th level the armor class bonus granted to creatures affected by your defensive stance increases to +2.

You can push yourself beyond your normal limits in order to uphold your position in formation. Starting at 15th level, if you roll initiative with no uses of your defensive maneuvers remaining, you regain one use.

sheet.description: When you roll initiative with no uses of your defensive maneuvers remaining, you regain one use.

description.p: You have mastered the fighting techniques of the Phalanx and pass its benefits on to your allies. When you enter your defensive stance, you can choose to expend a use of your defensive maneuver ability to extend the effects of your stance to creatures of your choice within 10 feet.
This improved defensive stance lasts for one minute, until you fall unconscious, or you end it as a bonus action.

sheet.description: When you enter your defensive stance, you can choose to expend a use of your defensive maneuver ability to extend the effects of your stance to creatures of your choice within 10 feet for up to 1 minute.

description.p: The secret to being a successful adventurer often lies in your ability to work as part of a team. Quartermasters are fighters that not only work to increase their own combat capability, but strive to help their allies reach their full potential. Often putting the needs of their companions ahead of their own, they support their teammates with a slew of prepared rations.

A Quartermaster is always there to make sure their adventuring party is in top condition, and ready to face any challenge that lies in their path. The companions of a quartermaster will never face their obstacles alone.

Starting at 3rd level, your training allows you to prepare rations that keep your allies in top condition. At the end of a long rest, you prepare a number of rations equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). You can prepare any ration from the list at the end of this subclass description as long as you meet it’s level requirements. You can use your action to eat or feed a creature within 5 feet one ration.

Creatures can only be under the effect of one ration at a time, and consuming a new ration immediately ends any current ration effects. Rations lose their potency and expire at the end of your next long rest. Rations can be distributed to the party at any point during the adventuring day, and can be consumed by any creature as an action.
If a ration has prerequisites, like your fighter level, you must meet them to prepare it. You can prepare the ration at the same time that you meet its prerequisites.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, you can prepare up to {{con-mod:min-one}} rations. You can use your action to eat or feed a creature within 5 feet one ration. Rations can be distributed to the party at any point during the adventuring day, and can be consumed by any creature as an action.

At the end of a long rest, you can prepare up to {{con-mod:min-one}} improved or regular rations. You can use your bonus action to eat or feed a creature within 5 feet one ration. Rations can be distributed to the party at any point during the adventuring day, and can be consumed by any creature as an bonus action.

At the end of a short or long rest, you can prepare up to {{con-mod:min-one}} improved or regular rations. You can use your bonus action to eat or feed a creature within 5 feet one ration. Rations can be distributed to the party at any point during the adventuring day, and can be consumed by any creature as an bonus action.

description.p: Beginning at 3rd level, you gain abilities necessary for you to shoulder the burdens of your allies. You gain proficiency in Animal Handling, vehicles (land), and your choice of either carpenter’s tools or cook’s utensils. If you are already proficient in any of these skills or tools, you gain Expertise, which means you add double your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make with that proficiency.

Starting at 7th level you use your skills as a quartermaster to make sure your allies always have the supplies they need to thrive. As a bonus action on your turn, you can use one of the following abilities on a target within 5 feet of you.
Aid. You allow a willing, or unconscious, creature to drink a potion, consume ration, or eat another consumable item.

Arm. You give a weapon or item you are carrying to a willing creature. The creature can equip the weapon or item you give them, and stow their current weapon or item, as a free action. You can also use this ability to give a creature any amount of ranged ammunition you are carrying.
Handiwork. You can make an ability check using any skill or tool proficiency you gained from your Workhorse feature.
You allow a willing, or unconscious, creature to drink a potion, consume ration, or eat another consumable item.

sheet.description: You allow a willing, or unconscious, creature to drink a potion, consume ration, or eat another consumable item.

description.p: You give a weapon or item you are carrying to a willing creature. The creature can equip the weapon or item you give them, and stow their current weapon or item, as a free action. You can also use this ability to give a creature any amount of ranged ammunition you are carrying.

sheet.description: You give a weapon or item you are carrying to a willing creature. The creature can equip the weapon or item you give them, and stow their current weapon or item, as a free action. You can also use this ability to give a creature any amount of ranged ammunition you are carrying.

description.p: You can make an ability check using any skill or tool proficiency you gained from your Workhorse feature.

sheet.description: You can make an ability check using any skill or tool proficiency you gained from your Workhorse feature.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, you’ve improved the process of supplying an adventuring party. When you prepare your rations at the end of a long rest, you now prepare the improved versions.
Additionally, you have made your rations more compact while still retaining their potency. Your rations can be consumed by, or fed to, a willing creature as a bonus action.

Beginning at 15th level you are always ready to support those who travel with you. You now prepare a number rations equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1) at the end of every short or long rest. These rations expire at the end of your next short or long rest.
Additionally, if you roll initiative with no rations remaining, you immediately prepare one ration of your choice.

sheet.description: When you roll initiative with no rations remaining, you immediately prepare one ration of your choice.

description.p: Your close work with your rations and supplies has toughened your body and soul to a point only few have reached. Upon reaching 18th level your Constitution score, and maximum Constitution score, both increase by 2.

Additionally, you are always under the effect of one ration of your choice. The ration must have a duration longer then instantaneous. You can change this effect at the end of every short or long rest.

sheet.description: You are always under the effect of one ration of your choice. The ration must have a duration longer then instantaneous. You can change this effect at the end of every short or long rest.

description.p: Duration: 1 minute
Upon consumption, a creature chooses either Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution and gains advantage on all ability checks and saving throws for the chosen ability score.
At 10th level the duration of the effect increases to 1 hour.
Duration: instantaneous
Upon consumption, a creature immediately regains hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level.

At 10th level the hit points a creature regains increases to 2d10 + your fighter level, and any hit points they regain that exceed their hit point maximum become temporary hit points, replacing any temporary hit points they already have.
Duration: instantaneous
Upon consumption, a creature can end one of the following conditions currently effecting it (their choice): blinded, defend, or poisoned, or reduce it’s exhaustion level by one.
At 10th level, this ration can also cure the following conditions: charm, fear, or paralysis.
Duration: instantaneous
This ration must be consumed as part of a short rest. Upon consumption, a creature gains advantage on the roll for any hit dice they choose to expend during their short rest.
At 10th level, consuming this ration allows a creature to treat any hit dice they choose expend during the short rest as their maximum roll.
Duration: instantaneous

Upon consumption a creature regains one expended spell slot of a level equal to or less than your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). A creature must have the ability to cast a spell in order to gain the benefit of this ration.
At 10th level the creature can regain expended spell slots of a combined level equal to or less than your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).
Duration: 1 minute
Upon consumption a creature’s speed increases by 10 feet.
At 10th level their speed increases by 20 feet.
Duration: 1 minute
Upon consumption a creature chooses bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, and they gain resistance to all non-magical damage of that type for the duration.
At 10th level consuming this ration grants resistance to all non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
Duration: 1 minute
Upon consumption the creature chooses either acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder, and they gain resistance to that damage type for the duration.
At 10th level the duration of the effect increases to 1 hour.
Duration: 1 minute
Upon consumption, a creature chooses either Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma and gains advantage on all ability checks and saving throws for the chosen ability score.
At 10th level the duration of the effect increases to 1 hour.
Duration: 1 hour
Upon consumption a creature is immune to one of the following conditions of their choice: charmed, frightened, poisoned, paralyzed, or stunned.
Duration: 1 hour
Upon consumption a creature chooses either force, necrotic, psychic, or radiant, and they gain resistance to that damage type for the duration.
Duration: instantaneous

Upon consumption a creature immediately regains hit points equal to your fighter level and can either move its full movement speed, take one action, or use a bonus action. Once this special action is completed they immediately suffer one level of exhaustion.
Duration: 1 hour

For the duration, a creature that consumes this ration does not fall unconscious when they are reduced to 0 hit points. However, while at 0 hit points the creature must still make death saving throws as normal, and upon 3 failures they die.
Duration: instantaneous

Upon consumption a creature instantly gains all the benefits of a short rest, including hit dice. At the end of this special rest they immediately gain one level of exhaustion. A creature that consumes this ration cannot gain the benefits of another ration until they finish a long rest.
